document.docAuthor: Long, Khuat Dang & Mai, Pham Quynh
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Zaglyptogastra Ashmead, 1900 (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Braconinae) from Vietnam

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Zaglyptogastra Ashmead, 1900 (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Braconinae) from Vietnam

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1.
Zaglyptogastra vietnamica
sp. n.
Female (holotype) habitus.

FIGURES 2–13.
Zaglyptogastra vietnamica
sp. n.
2. Head dorsal, 3. Head anterior, 4. Scapus lateral, 5. Second-fourth maxillary palp, 6. Propodeum dorsal, 7. First tergite dorsal, 8. Second-fifth metasomal segments dorsal, 9. Lateral aspect of apical part of ovipositor, 10. Basal part of hind wing, 11. Apical part of fore wing, 12. Medial part of ovipositor sheath showing long setae, 13. Apex of hind tibia lateral.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material . Holotype , female ( VNMN ), ‘Bracn. 1293 ’, [NW Vietnam :] Son La, Phu Yen, mango orchard,
N 21 ° 13 ’07.9”
E 104 ° 32 ’ 39.7 ”
, 350m , sweep net,
18 .vi. 2015
, KD Long.

Remarks .
Zaglyptogastra vietnamica
sp. n. is more or less abberant as it differs from known
Zaglyptogastra
species by having a distinct mediobasal area (
Fig. 8
).
